articles.author: Jenni Reid
articles.title: Europe stocks dip as German economy stagnates; Bank of Japan jolts markets - CNBC
articles.description: European stock markets opened lower Friday after the Bank of Japan rattled markets.
articles.content:
Germany's economy failed to show any growth in the second quarter, according to official data. Analysts had expected the country to eke out a 0.1% increase in GDP.

articles.title: Shocking! CME with SEVERE solar storm potential hits Solar Orbiter satellite at 1500 km per second - HT Tech
articles.description: A farside CME struck the European Space Agency’s (ESA) Solar Orbiter at the speed of 1500 km/s. The CME was powerful enough to spark a severe solar storm on Earth. Check details.

articles.title: Aeolus: 'Impossible satellite' ready to fall to Earth - BBC
articles.description: One of the most challenging space missions launched by Europe is about to come out of the sky.
articles.content:
A British-built spacecraft is expected to fall to Earth later on Friday, after completing a transformative mission to map the planet's winds.

articles.title: Hottest July ever signals 'era of global boiling has arrived' says UN chief - UN News
articles.description: As wildfires raged across Southern Europe and North Africa, top UN climate scientists said on Thursday that it was “virtually certain” that July 2023 will be the warmest on record.
articles.content:
Echoing that warning in New York, UN Secretary-General António Guterressaid that short of a mini-Ice Age in coming days, July 2023 would likely shatter records across the board.

articles.content:
A European satellite is making a first-of-its kind return to Earth this week.
